intro: Eleutherococcus yui, commonly known as the Japanese prickly ash, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Hippocastanaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant produces small, woody fruits that contain several seeds. Eleutherococcus yui is often grown for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight.
